glosses: To be excited, lively and energetic.
To feel an affection towards someone shortly after meeting them, to hit it off.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish قانی قاینامق (ḳanı ḳaynamaḳ, “for one's blood to boil, to feel a glow of affection for one's own flesh and blood”), equivalent to compound of kan (“blood”) + -ı (possessive suffix) + kaynamak (“to boil”), literally “for one's blood to boil”. Cognate with Azerbaijani qanı qaynamaq (“to feel affection for someone”), Kazakh қаны қайнау (qany qainau, “to get excited”), Tatar qan qaynatu (“to get filled with anger”), Uzbek qoni qaynamoq (“to get filled with anger”).
